splash.content: Hello, I am apprentice web developer John Dulaney and welcome to my site! I say apprentice because I am currently enrolled in a full stack front end web development course at the Nashville Software School. This site is a representation of skills I have learned/am learning, as well as a project we are require to keep up with.
splash.contentTwo: A short little bio: I was born November 22nd, 1988 in Knoxville Tennessee and have been living between East and middle TN my whole life, save the 5 years I attended a military academy in Missouri (Wentworth Military Academy). I graduated and Commissioned as an officer in the National Guard from there and soon attended the University of Missouri where a car accident ended my Army career and left me in a wheelchair. I have since returned to the Nashville area and attend NSS with high hopes on becoming a competent and successful web developer.

1.name: Website
1.description: This website you are currently on is one of my starting projects at Nashville Software School. It will continue to grow as my knowledge of programming expands. I intend to keep this bad boy updated.

2.name: Class Work
2.description: These are a few exercises assigned by NSS instructors to help use practice certain skills. Paired with the team oriented website building practice, I am developing a great working knowledge of the industry.

3.name: Nutshell
3.description: Nutshell is a psuedo social media single page app. It provided the user the ability to create tasks, add events, share news, and message other users(so long as they were on localhost.
3.teammates: Chase Steely, Max Wolf, and Paul Ellis

4.name: Capstone
4.description: We are 100% on the demands of this project yet, but we have seen our sister cohorts examples. Something along the lines of our own Application! Sounds fun.

1.title: Produce Clerk
1.responsibilities: Chop fruit and keep the aisles lookoing good

2.title: Private, Cadet, Platoon Leader
2.responsibilities: Ensure my platoon of 36 men were as lethal as possible and that all the needs of my commanders were met

3.title: Stay at home son/student
3.responsibilities: Keep the house clean and make life easy for elderly parents/recover from broken back/go to school
